subject: Self Care
title: Gratitude Journaling
description: A quick, practical guide to Gratitude Journaling.

hook.text: Five minutes before bed. Three things you appreciated today. Within two weeks, participants slept better and worried less.

buildup.text: Gratitude journaling works because writing forces specificity. Vague gratitude is weak. Detailed gratitude is transformative.

discovery.text: The key is novelty: don't repeat the same items daily. Finding new gratitudes strengthens the brain's scanning for positivity.

twist.text: Writing by hand activates more brain regions than typing. A physical journal produces stronger effects than a digital one.

climax.text: Get a small notebook. Keep it by your bed. Each night, three new specific things. Don't skip weekends. Consistency compounds.

punchline.text: Handwrite three new gratitudes nightly. Specificity is the secret.

quiz.question: What makes gratitude journaling most effective?
options: Repeating the same three items daily
Writing new, specific items each time to strengthen the brain's positivity scanning
